com.amitinside.featureflags

Interface FeatureManager


  • @ProviderType
public interface FeatureManager
    The FeatureManager service is the application access point to the feature flags functionality. It can be used to query the available features. It is also used to manage these instances pretty easily. Therefore FeatureManager service allows introspection of the feature instances available in runtime.

    Access to this service requires the ServicePermission[FeatureManager, GET] permission. It is intended that only administrative bundles should be granted this permission to limit access to the potentially intrusive methods provided by this service.

    See Also:
    FeatureDTO

    • Field Detail

      • METATYPE_FEATURE_ID_PREFIX

        static final String METATYPE_FEATURE_ID_PREFIX
        The prefix of the feature identifier pattern. This prefix should be used with the feature id in OSGi Metatype XML Configuration to identify unique features in an OSGi configuration.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FEATURE_CAPABILITY_NAME

        static final String FEATURE_CAPABILITY_NAME
        Capability name for feature

        Used in Provide-Capability and Require-Capability manifest headers with the osgi.extender namespace. For example: 

         Require-Capability: osgi.extender;
  filter:="(&(osgi.extender=osgi.feature)(version>=1.0)(!(version>=2.0)))"
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getFeatures

        Stream<FeatureDTO> getFeatures()
        Retrieve all (known) FeatureDTO instances registered in the runtime

        FeatureDTOs are known if they are configured with OSGi configuration

        Returns:
        The known FeatureDTO instances

      • getFeatures

        Stream<FeatureDTO> getFeatures(String featureID)
        Returns all (known) FeatureDTO instances registered with the specified feature ID

        FeatureDTO instances are known if they are registered with OSGi configuration.

        Parameters:
        featureID - The feature ID
        Returns:
        The known FeatureDTO instances
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if featureID is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if featureID is empty

      • updateFeature

        void updateFeature(String featureID,
                   boolean isEnabled)
        Updates the specified feature. If there exists multiple features with the same identifier, all feature instances will therefore be updated to teh specified enablement flag.
        Parameters:
        featureID - The feature ID
        isEnabled - the value for the enablement of the feature
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if featureID is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if featureID is empty
